Question_1.Context: Preclinical evaluation of a potential chelator for 223Ra-complexation
Question_1.Question: Which chelator exhibited the highest affinity for Ra2+ in liquid-liquid extraction experiments?
Question_1.Source: Calix-TA showed the highest affinity for Ra2+, its extraction constant in water/chloroform being 2.2- and 3.5-fold higher than DOTA and Kryptofix 2.2.2, respectively.

Question_2.Context: Evaluation of a potential chelator for 223Ra-based radiopharmaceuticals
Question_2.Question: Which chelator exhibited a stability constant of logK0 = 7.82 for the [223Ra][Ra(DOTA)]2− complex?
Question_2.Source: The logK0 value of 7.82 was measured for the [223Ra][Ra(DOTA)]2− complex.

Question_3.Context: Evaluation of a potential chelator for 223Ra-based radiopharmaceuticals
Question_3.Question: Which chelator showed limited ability to extract [223Ra]Ra2+ from water to chloroform and no selectivity over other alkaline earth cations?
Question_3.Source: Lin-crown-5-2A exhibited high extraction efficiency of [223Ra]Ra2+ from water to chloroform but showed no selectivity for Ra2+ over the other alkaline earth metal cations.

Question_4.Context: Evaluation of a potential chelator for 223Ra-based radiopharmaceuticals
Question_4.Question: Which chelator formed a [223Ra][Ra-Calix-TA] complex with an extraction constant 5.7-fold lower than DOTA?
Question_4.Source: Calix-TA exhibited an extraction constant 5.7-fold lower than DOTA for the [223Ra][Ra-Calix-TA] complex.

Question_5.Context: Preclinical evaluation of a potential chelator for 223Ra-complexation
Question_5.Question: Which chelator underwent competition experiments against serum-abundant metals and showed rapid dissociation and transmetallation phenomena?
Question_5.Source: Calix-TA underwent rapid dissociation and transmetallation phenomena in competition experiments against serum-abundant metals.

Question_6.Context: Evaluation of a potential chelator for 223Ra-based radiopharmaceuticals
Question_6.Question: Which chelator formed a [223Ra][Ra(DTPA)]3− complex with a stability constant of logK0 = 10.74?
Question_6.Source: DTPA formed a [223Ra][Ra(DTPA)]3− complex with a stability constant of logK0 = 10.74.

Question_7.Context: Evaluation of a potential chelator for 223Ra-based radiopharmaceuticals
Question_7.Question: Which chelator showed high extraction efficiency of [223Ra]Ra2+ from water to chloroform but no selectivity for Ra2+ over other alkaline earth metal cations?
Question_7.Source: Lin-crown-5-2A exhibited high extraction efficiency of [223Ra]Ra2+ from water to chloroform but showed no selectivity for Ra2+ over the other alkaline earth metal cations.

Question_8.Context: Evaluation of a potential chelator for 223Ra-based radiopharmaceuticals
Question_8.Question: Which chelator formed a [223Ra][Ra-Calix-TA] complex with an extraction constant 5.7-fold lower than DOTA?
Question_8.Source: Calix-TA exhibited an extraction constant 5.7-fold lower than DOTA for the [223Ra][Ra-Calix-TA] complex.

Question_9.Context: Evaluation of a potential chelator for 223Ra-based radiopharmaceuticals
Question_9.Question: Which chelator underwent competition experiments against serum-abundant metals and showed rapid dissociation and transmetallation phenomena?
Question_9.Source: Calix-TA underwent rapid dissociation and transmetallation phenomena in competition experiments against serum-abundant metals.

Question_10.Source: DTPA formed a [223Ra][Ra(DTPA)]3− complex with a stability constant of logK0 = 10.74.
